metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39318 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.Description:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affectedversions of FreeRDP are missing input validation in `urbdrc` channel. Amalicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to crash with division byzero. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0. All users are advisedto upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should not use the `/usb` redirectionswitch.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
freerdp2-wayland - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
freerdp2-x11 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libuwac0-0 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libwinpr2-2 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
winpr-utils - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1').
